text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: You learn more from failure than from success. Don't let it stop you. Failure builds character.
author: Unknown

text: If you are working on something that you really care about, you don't have to be pushed. The vision pulls you.
author: Steve Jobs

text: People who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do.
author: Rob Siltanen

text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

text: Entrepreneurs are great at dealing with uncertainty and also very good at minimizing risk. That's the classic entrepreneur.
author: Mohnish Pabrai

text: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The successful warrior is the average man with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
author: Helen Hayes

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

text: What you lack in talent can be made up with time, hustle and dedication.
author: Chantal Straznich

text: Do what you can with all you have, wherever you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: You are enough just as you are.
author: Meghan Markle

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: The harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: I never dreamed about success, I worked for it.
author: Estee Lauder

text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
author: Jimmy Johnson

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
author: Andre Gide

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Life is what happens to us while we are making other plans.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A gentleman is one who never hurts anyone's feelings unintentionally.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When poverty comes in at the door, love flies out at the window.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: True friends stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The old believe everything; the middle-aged suspect everything; the young know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I can resist everything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are only two tragedies in life: one is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To define is to limit.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A man who does not think for himself does not think at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Consistency is the hallmark of the unimaginative.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Anybody can make history. Only a great man can write it.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Arguments are extremely vulgar, for everyone in good society holds exactly the same opinion.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Art is the only serious thing in the world. And the artist is the only person who is never serious.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A bore is a person who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: All art is quite useless.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That's his.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: As long as war is regarded as wicked, it will always have its fascination. When it becomes virtuous, it will cease to be popular.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Discontent is the first necessity of progress.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Genius is born—not paid.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Hatred is blind, as well as love.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I am not young enough to know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Ignorance is like a delicate exotic fruit; touch it and the bloom is gone.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: In matters of grave importance, style, not sincerity is the vital concern.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is always the unreadable that occurs.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is awfully easy to be hard-boiled about everything in the daytime, but at night it is another thing.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: It is not worth an intelligent man's time to be in the majority. By definition, there are already enough people to do that.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It often happens that the real criminals are quite unexceptional in appearance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Life has been your art. You have set yourself to music. Your days are your sonnets.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people whom we personally dislike.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: My wallpaper and I are fighting a duel to the death. One or the other of us has got to go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: No writer can seriously hope to do anything more than state his own perfection.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: One should either be sad or joyful. I am tired of this grey existence.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: One's real life is so often the life that one does not lead.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: People are afraid of themselves, nowadays.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Romance should never begin with sentiment. It should begin with science and end with a settlement.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: She behaves as if she was beautiful. That is enough for her.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Sincere people are always trustworthy. They know nothing about life. They are domestic animals.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Sometimes a man's greatest tragedy is that he was faithful to a woman who deserved it better than she got it.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The charitable are injudicious. We owe a great deal to the poor. They certainly teach us the meaning of kindness. But they are injudicious. Charity creates a great many evils.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The chief advantage of having a heart is that people sometimes steal your heart, but they never steal your liver.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The demand for a repeated performance shows that the drama was a failure.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The moment you think you understand a great work of art, it's dead for you.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The mystery of love is greater than the mystery of death.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The noblest way of taking vengeance is to forgive.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The old world is dying, and the new world struggles to be born: now is the time of monsters.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only difference between a caprice and a lifelong passion is that a caprice lasts a little longer.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only thing that one really knows about human nature is that it changes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only things to do in life are those that you do badly.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The true perfection of man lies not in what man has, but in what man is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are two ways of disliking poetry; one way is to dislike it, the other is to read Pope.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is a luxury in self-reproach. When we blame ourselves we feel no one else has a right to blame us.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is always something ridiculous about the emotions of people whom one has ceased to love.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is no sin except stupidity.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written or badly written. That is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is only one thing in life worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is something tragic about the enormous number of young men in England who start life with perfect profiles and end by adopting some useful profession.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To cure the soul of narrowness, liberalize the mind, and cultivate the heart.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune. To lose both looks like carelessness.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Vanity is the only true aristocrat.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When a man has no enemy left, there is no reason for him to be immortal.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When good Americans die they go to Paris.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When the gods wish to punish us, they answer our prayers.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Women are pictures in prose. Men are novels in verse.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Women love us for our defects. If we have enough of them, they will forgive us everything, even our intellects.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Women were created to be surprises. When they cease to be surprises they become necessities.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: Men seldom make passes at girls who wear glasses.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: I require three things in a man: he must be handsome, ruthless, and stupid.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: That woman speaks eighteen languages, and can't say 'No' in any of them.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: The best way to keep children home is to make the home a pleasant atmosphere... and let the air out of the tires.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: If you have any young friends who aspire to become writers, the second greatest favor you can do them is to present them with copies of The Elements of Style. The first greatest, of course, is to shoot them now, while they're happy.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie – deliberate, contrived and dishonest – but the myth – persistent, persuasive and unrealistic.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: We are not here merely to make a living. We are here to enrich humanity.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: The future starts today, not tomorrow.
author: Pope John Paul II

text: Do not abandon yourselves to despair. Let hope inspire you. Hope can triumph over everything.
author: Pope John Paul II

text: We must not allow ourselves to become like the system we oppose.
author: Bishop Desmond Tutu

text: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
author: Desmond Tutu

text: If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
author: Desmond Tutu

text: There comes a point where we need to turn the page, not just bookmark it.
author: Desmond Tutu

text: I have a dream.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Never, never, and never again shall it be that this beautiful land will again experience the oppression of one by another.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is no passion to be found playing small – in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Resentment is like drinking poison and then hoping it will kill your enemies.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: A winner is a dreamer who never gives up.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Lead from the back — and let others believe they are in front.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Do not judge me by my successes, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is no easy walk to freedom anywhere, and many of us will have to pass through the valley of the shadow of death again and again before we reach the mountaintop of our desires.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: To be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Nonviolence is a powerful and just weapon, which cuts without wounding and ennobles the man who wields it. It is a sword that heals.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: In the practice of tolerance, one's enemy is the best teacher.
author: J.K. Rowling
